revised_title: George Albert Boulenger: A Pioneering Taxonomist in Amphibia, Reptiles, and Fishes
tldr: George Albert Boulenger was a renowned taxonomist who specialized in the classification and study of amphibians, reptiles, and fishes. He made significant contributions to the understanding of their taxonomy, geographical distribution, and evolution. Boulenger's work laid the foundation for modern classifications and research in these fields. He was also known for his vast knowledge, orderly mind, and ability to discuss general problems in addition to taxonomic issues.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Herpetology and Ichthyology
